title: Great but has a playback bug that really annoys me
comment: I love the features on this player, but there is one bug that annoys the heck out of me. Many times, when I skip to the next track on the playlist, there is no music playing even though the progress bar and time is moving along. The only way to get it playing is to press the pause button and then press play again. This happens in offline mode as well as online mode. It didn't always do this before, so I don't know what happened. I've used this player for well over a year, but this problem just started like a month or two ago. *update*: I did try reinstalling Dsub, but after reinstalling, i found that it remembered all of my settings. I found that the playback problem seems to be related to my bluetooth speaker (UE Boom). When i use dsub w/o the bluetooth speaker, everything seems to behaves normally. Very strange problem. Possibly the player stops sending signals to the speaker in between song skips and it has trouble reinitiating when the next song starts? I can hear slight clicky sounds on the bluetooth speaker when skipping tracks.
You can try reinstalling DSub. That will reset the settings and make sure it wasn't a corrupted update screwing stuff up.

Has even been kind enough to pass on important compatibility information for Ampache devs for better overall experience.  Well worth the purchase.

DSub has many more features above Ultrasonic beyond just cast support.  I would argue that neither of those things are very common since no one asks for them.  Videos show up and are playable in folders just like music.  If they don't that is an Ampache issue.  Dsub just doesn't have the massive list of all videos in one place.

title: Excellent subsonic app
comment: A.very good subsonic client - easy to use, good layout, reliable. My only gripe is the lack of support for multiple tags in the same field, i.e. tags separated by some separator, for example "jazz;free jazz;experimental" as the genre tag, which should result in the song being found under all of the three genres listed, or "Sunn O)));Boris" as the artist field, which should result in the song (and the whole album of the song) being listed under both the artists "Sunn O)))" and "Boris". This is the way squeezeserver operates and really should be the standard, but I am yet to find a mobile music streaming app that allows this basic functionality. Edit: Changed the rating to 5 stars after a developer reply explaining that lack of multiple tag/tag separator issue is a limitation of the subsonic server itself and not due to app design.
That's not something I can control unfortunately. Support for that has to come from the server. DSub is just displaying the genres and what songs belong to that genre the server serves up.
Works great! Should casting not work, try to restart your Chromecast first.

I realize the Chromecast is fairly new, so the rating may seem unfair, however this app doesn't seem to be much different from the actual Subsonic app. At least not different enough to justify the price.   I'm using this on a Nexus 10 which can be fickle about WiFi connections. Yet, it streams Netflix and other Chromecast enabled content without issue. Dsub, stops playing albums & playlists for no reason. Physically connecting the N10 to the stereo and using the Subsonic app to connect to my server has no streaming issues.  If you don't like ads, by all means purchase this app for use with your Subsonic server. I appreciate that someone is developing apps for use with Subsonic and I am happy to contribute. Unfortunately, my expectations are not yet met.

If you are still having issues with it stopping after the update can you send me a log? It was doing that for some people specifically because it was disconnecting and reconnecting and it wasn't handling it correctly and now it should be (at least in my testing). title: False & Misleading Description
comment: Very surprised that neither the overview or any of these reviews point out that the $1.99 is for a 30 day trial, after which you must "donate" between 10 & 50 British pounds if you want to continue using the app.   Naturally the site does not inform you what your "donation" entitles you to, but considering the scam perpetuated here, I suspect 10 pounds will get you six months at most. I previously used Audiogalaxy, a free app that worked great but sadly, is no longer supported.  I had hoped DSub would be at least as good (after all it costs money) but sadly found it frequently does not recognize audio files with FLAC or .shn extensions. Overall, DSub would be a disappointing product for $1.99; and an absolute rip off for failing to advise "customers" of the 30 day limitation.  I'm amazed that the Google Play Developer Distribution Agreement allows Floss to list this app on their site without providing full disclosure concerning the limitation of the service.

The 30 day trial is a limitation imposed by the Subsonic server software, not by DSub.  I am a different developer then the person who created Subsonic, and cannot dictate what Sindre does and does not do with his server software.

title: Bluetooth is derpy (only reason I bought it)
comment: I bought it for the single reason of hoping it worked with my car's bluetooth playback better than the official Subsonic app.  Google Play and even Apollo will display track information and album artwork on my car's dash monitor when playing songs over a bluetooth connection.  Next/Prev track work great with those two apps.  Unfortunately, none of this works properly with DSub or the official Subsonic app.  When I hit next/prev track it stops playing.  I have to hit play to make it play the next track.  I find the DSub/Subsonic interfaces much more intuitive and easier to use than Google Play Music app so this is extremely disappointing.   I'm basically stuck using dsub/subsonic apps to download music to my phone and using different apps to actually play back the music.    Otherwise this is a great alternative to the stock app.  So if you don't care about bluetooth then I do highly recommend this.  ***EDIT*** Beta is available that makes bluetooth work PERFECTLY in my car.   5 stars for when that beta is released to the play store.  Well done dev!
